modules.description: This module provides functions for inspecting and transforming EDN values, including extracting keys and values, converting to lists or associative pairs, and mapping over elements. It supports operations like type-safe field access, combining values, and checking membership. Concrete use cases include parsing EDN structures into native OCaml types such as strings, numbers, and lists, and traversing nested EDN data.

This module defines a JSON data type with standard constructors like `Assoc`, `List`, and `String`, and provides bidirectional conversion between JSON values and EDN values. It supports parsing JSON into EDN with optional keywordization of keys and converting EDN back to JSON. Concrete use cases include serializing EDN data to JSON for API responses and deserializing JSON input into EDN for configuration or data exchange formats.

This module defines a recursive algebraic data type for representing EDN (Extensible Data Notation) values, including support for maps, lists, vectors, sets, scalars, symbols, keywords, and tagged values. It provides functions for parsing EDN from strings and input channels, as well as converting EDN values to strings. Concrete use cases include reading and writing configuration files, serializing and deserializing data for storage or transmission, and processing EDN-based APIs or data formats.
